basics.name: Yifeng Xu
basics.label: Master's Student in Robotics
basics.summary: Master's student in Robotics at the University of Michigan, Ann Arbor. Interested in robotic manipulation, reinforcement learning, and control.

work.name: Vision and Image Processing Lab
highlights: Leveraged vision foundation models, Depth-PR, and Depth Anything to generate metric and relative depth images.
Used Segment Anything to assign semantic information for primitive geometry estimation.
Trained a PointNet AutoEncoder to encode partially observed point clouds into latent features.
Planned to use Isaac Sim for graspability-aware robotic grasping under single-camera view.

work.name: Hybrid Dynamics Robotics Lab
highlights: Designed a three-bar tensegrity robot and simulated locomotion using MuJoCo physics engine.
Built and tested state machines on robots for various locomotion, including rolling, crawling, and turning.

projects.name: Learning Latent Dynamics for Robotic Pushing Task
projects.description: Developed a Variational Autoencoder (VAE) to learn latent dynamics for robotic pushing tasks using PyBullet and PyTorch.
highlights: Generated trajectories from demonstrations and trained VAE to predict future actions and states.
Achieved 85% success rate for robotic pushing task and obstacle avoidance.

projects.name: Customizable Scene Synthesis for Robust Visual Odometry
projects.description: Implemented a CNN-based monocular visual odometry for autonomous driving in challenging conditions.
highlights: Applied instance-level segmentation and LaMa inpainting to remove dynamic objects.
Tested on KITTI dataset with robust performance.

projects.name: 6-DOF Pose Estimation based on PoseCNN
projects.description: Developed a convolutional neural network for 6D object pose estimation in cluttered scenes using PyTorch.
highlights: Achieved state-of-the-art pose estimation on PROPS Pose dataset.
